Dr. A. van der Merwe


Prof. J. van Niekerk
My research areas are Bayesian methods, Biostatistics, Spatial Statistics and Computational Statistics. Most of my work has been at the intersection between statistical methods and the computing of those methods. I am a developer of three R packages; INLA, INLAjoint and graphpcor. My Google Scholar is available here. I have projects available but also get excited by your project ideas - so feel free to bring your own!
I have four projects spaces available for 2026.


Dr. P.J. van Staden


Mr. A. van Wyk


Mrs. L. Venter


Dr. A. Whata

text:

title: Projects
text:
The reliability of OLS regression in large-scale observational data when multicollinearity is present by Judy Kleyn
Shrinkage versus sparsity in feature selection: Evidence from simulation studies by Judy Kleyn
Dealing with outliers in regression modelling: OLS versus quantile regression by Judy Kleyn
ABC for Disease mapping models by Janet van Niekerk
Machine learning for ABC by Janet van Niekerk
Non-linear association joint models for clinical trials by Janet van Niekerk
Variational inference for survival data by Janet van Niekerk

title: Welcome
text:
This website contains information on the available projects and researchers within the Department of Statistics at the University of Pretoria. Use this information to apply for a project hosted by a specific researcher, using the Application tab.
The projects are awarded based on availablity.

title: About
text:
This website is maintained by Janet van Niekerk (janet.vanNiekerk@up.ac.za)
It is used to host the Honours research projects information for the Department of Statistics at the University of Pretoria.
